questions.title: Since World War II, war deaths have decreased
questions.description: ...and yet, both conflict and violence are currently on the rise. Many conflicts today are fought between groups within countries, rather than between countries. While terrorism remains widespread, its death toll has been falling in recent years.

questions.title: In 2016, violent conflicts were at a 30-year peak
questions.description: Today, far more people are killed by crime than by armed conflicts. Conflicts spread beyond borders, and organized crime and gangs use political instability to become stronger. This requires countries to develop new strategies to solve conflicts.

choices.answer: More than half of the world population

questions.title: Political violence affects us all
questions.description: In the past 15 years, more than half of the world lived close to political violence. For women the situation is worse, their homes are the most dangerous place. In 2017, 58% of murders of women were carried out by their family or intimate partner.
